examples: The two parties agreed to abide by the judge's decision.
For years he has abided by a commitment to annual employee raises.
The agreement was signed by both parties.
We reached an agreement after a long discussion.
The contract is an agreement between the buyer and seller.
The sales associate gave his assurance that the missing keyboard would be replaced the next day.
Her self-assurance made it easy to see why she was in charge of the negotiations.
The cancellation of her flight caused her to miss the meeting.
The cancellation clause appears at the back of the contract.
After reading the contract, I was still unable to determine if our company was liable for back wages.
The skill of the union bargainers will determine whether the automotive plant will open next week.
Before engaging in a new business, it is important to do thorough research.
He engaged us in a fascinating discussion about current business trends.

Lesson 1.meaning: To institute permanently; to bring about
examples: Through her many books and interviews, Dr. Wan established herself as an authority on conflict resolution.
The merger of the two companies established a powerful new corporation.
The contractor was obligated by the contract to work 40 hours a week.
I felt obligated to finish the project even though I was not paid for it.

Lesson 1.meaning: A person or group participating in an action or plan; the persons or sides concerned in a legal matter
examples: The parties agreed to a settlement in their contract dispute.
The party that prepares the contract has a distinct advantage.

Lesson 1.meaning: A measure taken beforehand; a stipulation
examples: The father made provisions for his children through his will.
The contract contains a provision to deal with how payments are made if John loses his job.

Lesson 1.meaning: To deal with successfully; to declare
examples: The mediator was able to resolve the problem to everyone's satisfaction.
The businessman resolved to clean out all the files by the end of the week.
The customer's specific complaint was not addressed in his e-mail.
In a contract, one specific word can change the meaning dramatically.
The display attracted a number of people at the convention.
The new advertising campaign is designed to attract customers.
Once the customer compared the two products, her choice was easy.
The price for this brand is high compared to the other brands.
We competed against three other agencies to get this contract.
The company has to compete with others to stay in business.
The printer consumes more toner than the previous one.
This kind of work consumes a lot of time.

Lesson 2.meaning: To bring to believe by argument; to persuade
examples: He convinced me that he was right.
The salesman convinced his customer to buy his product.

Lesson 2.meaning: Happening or existing at the present time
examples: We are currently exploring new marketing strategies.
The current trend is towards more environmentally friendly products.

Lesson 2.meaning: A practice followed enthusiastically for a short time; a craze
examples: The mini dress was a fad in the 1960s.
His interest in photography is just a passing fad.
Her dedication to the job inspired everyone in the office.
The artist was inspired by the beautiful scenery.
They marketed their new product through social media.
The company markets its products worldwide.
The team had a very productive meeting.
She is one of the most productive employees in the company.

Lesson 2.meaning: To fulfill the needs or expectations
examples: The new product satisfied all our requirements.
He was satisfied with the results of the test.
One characteristic of the store is its excellent customer service.
The new product has several unique characteristics.
As a consequence of the new policy, many employees will lose their jobs.
The consequence of not following the safety guidelines could be severe.
We are considering several options for the new project.
She considered all the factors before making a decision.
The insurance policy covers the cost of repairs.
The warranty covers all parts and labor.

Lesson 3.meaning: The end of a period of time
examples: The expiration date is printed on the package.
Check the expiration of your passport before you travel.
The company frequently updates its software.
He travels frequently for business.
The report implies that the company is in good financial health.
Her tone implied that she was not happy with the decision.

Lesson 3.meaning: A declaration that something will or will not be done
examples: She made a promise to help him with his project.
The company has kept its promise to improve working conditions.
The new law protects the rights of consumers.
He wore a helmet to protect his head.
The company has a reputation for excellent customer service.
He built a reputation as a reliable worker.
The job requires a high level of skill.
The project requires careful planning.
The store offers a variety of products.
She enjoys a variety of activities in her free time.

Lesson 4.meaning: To direct to the attention of
examples: He addressed the issue of customer complaints in the meeting.
The letter was addressed to the company's CEO.

Lesson 4.meaning: To stay clear of; to keep from happening
examples: To avoid going out of business, owners should prepare a proper business plan.
She took a different route to avoid traffic.
The professor demonstrated the experiment to the students.
The sales team demonstrated the new product to potential customers.
The company developed a new software to improve customer service.
She developed her skills through years of practice.

Lesson 4.meaning: To determine the value or impact of
examples: The manager evaluated the performance of the team.
We need to evaluate the effectiveness of the new policy.
We gathered information from various sources.
The researchers gathered data for their study.

Lesson 4.meaning: To propose; to present in order to meet a need or satisfy a requirement
examples: The company offered a discount to attract new customers.
She offered her assistance to the new employee.
The advertisement is aimed primarily at young people.
The company's profits come primarily from its overseas operations.

Lesson 4.meaning: The chance of loss or damage
examples: Investing in stocks always carries some risk.
The company took a risk by launching a new product.
The company developed a new marketing strategy.
We need a strategy to increase our market share.
The company has a strong market position.
She has a strong background in finance.

Lesson 4.meaning: To take the place of another
examples: You can substitute margarine for butter in this recipe.
The coach substituted the injured player with a new one.
